result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED

Submit to DNA sample and pay costs. Cooperate with and complete any sex offender treatment and or aftercare programming deemed necessary by Department of Corrections. Cooperate with and complete any mental health treatment and or aftercare programming deemed necessary by Department of Corrections. Cooperate with and complete any chemical dependency treatment and or aftercare programming deemed necessary by Department of Correction. Must comply with sex offender registry. Pay all court obligations and fees as directed.

01:31 PM Defendant, Joseph T Krech, in custody, appeared with Attorney John Charles Bachman.  Prosecuting attorney Renee M Taber.  Defendant in custody.  Brad Erickson DOC agent in Court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk

Court - counsel had requested a continuation of sentencing
Bachman - deft believes he didn't receive discovery 
Deft - addresses paperwork he hasn't recd - feels its in violation of his rights 
Bachman - turned over everything he recd from previous attorney - we addressed this issue a while ago 

COURT:  not continuing sentencing - sentencing going forward

State - 3 yrs IC 3 yrs ES according to plea agreement
Bachman - addresses sentencing 
Erickson - believes all sex offenses would be ineligible
Bachman - asks for mandatory minimum, has taken all programming offered at jail - requests 3 yrs IC - not certain of jail credit - deft indicates he has 716 days credit at least possibly 790 days
State - has 680 days credit if this is concurrent to other case he was in prison for 

COURT:  requests Mr. Erickson and counsel calculate days credit today
Bachman - on Ct 1 6 yrs prison 3 yrs IC 3 yrs ES - Ct 10 1 yr prison concurrent
Deft - thought his sentencing was going to get postponed - addresses the Court

COURT:  Ct 1 $268 cc
                       $250 dna surchg
  ***60 DAYS TO PAY OR PAYMENT PLAN ALLOWED IF QUALIFIES***
                       Prison 6 yrs: 3 yrs IC 3 yrs ES - concurrent to other sentence & Ct 10
credit 680 days (counsel to calculate exact amount)

               Ct 10 $268 cc
                         $250 dna surchg
  ***60 DAYS TO PAY OR PAYMENT PLAN ALLOWED IF QUALIFIES***
                         Prison 36 months; 18 mo IC 18 mo ES concurrent to Ct 1

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Submit to DNA sample & pay costs
assessed $500 surchg on image on Ct 1
cooperate with & complete any sex offender treatment and/oir aftercare programming deemed necessary by DOC
cooperate with & complete any mental health treatment and/or aftercare programming deemed necessary by DOC
cooperate with & complete any chemical dependency treatment and/or aftercare programming deemed necessdary by the DOC
comply with sex offender registry
no unsupervised contact with minors
pay all court obligations & fees as directed
eligible for SAP - not eligible for CIP
psychosexual evaluation & PSI to be sealed
